title: can't build geth
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`
OS & Version: Windows 7/Ubunto16.04/
Commit hash : (if `develop`)
i'm  using golang 1.8.1
#### Expected behaviour
# github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/crypto/secp256k1
exec: "gcc": executable file not found in %PATH%
# github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/vendor/github.com/karalabe/hid

#### Actual behaviour


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour


#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

The geth codebase has some tiny parts of C code in it (crypto library, hardware wallets).

> In order to use cgo on Windows, you'll also need to first install a gcc compiler (for instance, mingw-w64) and have gcc.exe (etc.) in your PATH environment variable before compiling with cgo will work.
